alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 21 at 3:18PM MDT until June 21 at 11:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: .Heavy rainfall is possible with widespread convection this afternoon, through this evening, into tonight; soils are likely already saturated in many areas and excessive runoff is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH 6 AM MDT TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Eastern Adams and Arapahoe Counties, and the north slope of the Palmer Divide. (A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following areas, Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties and Elbert/Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet.) * WHEN...4 PM MDT this evening through 6 AM MDT tomorrow. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall on already saturated soils my cause excessive runoff and flooding across the warning area.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet
